thing-type.label: WPS104 Energy Driven Switch
thing-type.description: Energy Driven Switch<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtWiDom Energy Driven Switch is a device designed to monitor all <b&gtparameters</b&gt, <b&gtusage</b&gt, <b&gtfaults</b&gt and <b&gtoverloads </b&gtof your electrical system. Unlike an ordinary energy meter, WiDom Energy Driven Switch can be installed to monitor an entire electricity network or a section of the latter.</p&gt <p&gt· <b&gtActive Energy-saving management</b&gt</p&gt <p&gtAutomatically connects and disconnects a specific load if the established threshold limit is exceeded, or supplies the required power, momentarily excluding non-priority loads.</p&gt <p&gt· <b&gtManagement and prevention of electrical faults </b&gt</p&gt <p&gtIdentifies malfunctions based on irregular consumptions and to the maximum time of activity.</p&gt <p&gt· <b&gtElectrical overload management </b&gt</p&gt <p&gtNotifies or disconnects non-priority loads in the eventuality of system overloads.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtIf the device is not included into a Z-Wave network, a single click on the (B) button or on the external switch will launch the process of traditional inclusion. If the device inclusion procedure does not start within 2 seconds, the Network Wide Inclusion network will be launched lasting a variable amount of time between 15-30 seconds</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtOnly a controller can remove a device from the network. WiDom Energy Driven Switch is compatible with all Z-Wave certified controllers. After the exclusion procedure has been activated by the controller, the device can be removed, putting it in <i&gtExclusion</i&gt <i&gtMode</i&gt by three consecutive clicks on the (B) button or on the external switch, when available.</p&gt

parameter.name: config_1_1
parameter.label: 1: Device Status
parameter.description: How to control the relay<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtControlling the relay by means of a single click on the external switch or on the integrated button.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_20_1
parameter.label: 20: Device status upon receipt of a Basic Set command
parameter.description: Device status upon receipt of a Basic Set command<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe final status achieved by the device when it receives a <b&gt<i&gtBasic Set</i&gt</b&gt command through the Z-Wave network.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_30_2
parameter.label: 30: Overcurrent Level
parameter.description: Sets the overcurrent level<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSets the current level above which the time spent above that level is measured.</p&gt <p&gtVersion C: From 0 to 4500[1] hundredths of Amperes – Default Value: <b&gt4500 Hundredths of Amperes</b&gt</p&gt <p&gtVersion S: From 0 to 1250 hundredths of Amperes – Default Value: <b&gt1250 Hundredths of Amperes</b&gt</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_31_2
parameter.label: 31: Overcurrent Time
parameter.description: Sets the time to recognize an overcurrent event.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSets the time beyond which, in the case of overcurrent at a level higher than that established in parameter 30, an OverCurrent event occurs.</p&gt <p&gtFrom 0 to 10800 Seconds (3 Hours) – Default Value: <b&gt10 Seconds</b&gt</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_32_1
parameter.label: 32: Next State
parameter.description: Defines the next state if an overcurrent event occurr<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtDefines the next state of the device if an overcurrent event has occurred</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_33_4
parameter.label: 33: Meter Reset
parameter.description: Provides total operating time from last meter reset<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtProvides total operating time from last meter reset. When set to 0 it resets the cumulative values of energy and total operating time.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_34_1
parameter.label: 34: Energy flow
parameter.description: Determines whether if energy consumed or energy produced.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtDetermines whether energy events are related to energy consumed or energy produced.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_35_2
parameter.label: 35: UP Power Level
parameter.description: Sets the level of instantaneous power in Watts<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe upper limit power threshold detector determines when instantaneous power remains above the threshold point (UP Power Level) beyond a specified duration (UP Power Time). When this happens, a <i&gtUP Power Event</i&gt occurs.</p&gt <p&gtSets the level of instantaneous power in Watts beyond which time of permanence above this level is calculated. </p&gt <p&gtVersion C: From 0 to 11250[1] – Default value: <b&gt11250 </b&gt</p&gt <p&gtVersion S: From 0 to 3000 – Default value: <b&gt3000 </b&gt</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_36_2
parameter.label: 36: UP Power Time
parameter.description: Sets the time in seconds<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSets the time in seconds beyond which, if instantaneous power remains at levels exceeding threshold defined by parameter 35, a UP Power event occurs.</p&gt <p&gtFrom 0 to 10800 seconds (3 Hours) – Default value: <b&gt10 Seconds</b&gt</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_37_1
parameter.label: 37: UP Power State
parameter.description: Defines the next status case of a UP Power event<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtDefines the next status of the device in the case of a UP Power event occurring.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_38_1
parameter.label: 38: UP Power Associated
parameter.description: Defines the status of Group 2 devices<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtDefines the status of associated devices in the presence of a UP Power event.</p&gt <p&gtFrom: 1 to 99 for dimming purpose</p&gt <p&gt0 (OFF) and -1(ON) for switching ON/OFF.</p&gt <p&gtDefault: <b&gt0 – OFF</b&gt</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_39_2
parameter.label: 39: DOWN Power Level
parameter.description: Sets the level of instantaneous power in Watts<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSets the level of instantaneous power beyond which the time of permanence below this level is calculated.</p&gt <p&gtFrom 0 to 11250 Watt – Default value: <b&gt0 W</b&gt</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_40_2
parameter.label: 40: DOWN Power Time
parameter.description: Sets the time in seconds<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSets the time beyond which, if instantaneous power remains at levels below threshold defined by parameter 39, a DOWN Power event occurs. From 0 to 10800 Seconds (3 Hours) – Default value: <b&gt10 Seconds</b&gt</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_41_1
parameter.label: 41: DOWN Power State
parameter.description: Defines the next state case of a DOWN Power event<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtDefines the next state of the device in the case of a DOWN Power event occurring.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_42_1
parameter.label: 42: DOWN Power Associated
parameter.description: Defines the status of Group 3 devices<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtDefines the status of associated devices in the presence of a DOWN Power event.</p&gt <p&gtFrom: 1 to 99 for dimming purpose</p&gt <p&gt– 0 (OFF) and -1(ON) for switching ON/OFF.</p&gt <p&gtDefault: <b&gt0 – OFF</b&gt</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_43_4
parameter.label: 43: Energy Level
parameter.description: Sets the energy level in KWh<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSets the energy level that once exceeded an Energy Limit event occurs<b&gt.</b&gt</p&gt <p&gtFrom 0 to 2.000.000 KWh – Default value: <b&gt2.000.000 KWh</b&gt</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_44_1
parameter.label: 44: Energy Limit State
parameter.description: Defines the next state in case of Energy Limit event<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtDefines the next state of the device in the case of an Energy Limit event occurring.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_45_1
parameter.label: 45: Variation Instantaneous Power
parameter.description: Defines the percentage variation of instantaneous power<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtDefines the percentage variation of instantaneous power determining the sending of the report<b&gt. </b&gt</p&gt <p&gtFrom: 1 (1%) to 100 (100%) Default value: <b&gt10 – 10%</b&gt</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_46_1
parameter.label: 46: Report Time Frequency
parameter.description: Defines the time in minutes<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtDefines the maximum time in minutes since the previous report beyond which an Instantaneous Power Report will still be sent.</p&gt <p&gtFrom: 1 to 100 minutes. Default value: <b&gt10 minutes</b&gt</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_47_1
parameter.label: 47: Variation Total Energy
parameter.description: Defines the increase energy to generate a report<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtDefines the increase of total energy required to generate a report listing the level of total energy to the devices associated to the Energy Notification Group</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_48_2
parameter.label: 48: Nominal Voltage
parameter.description: Defines the nominal voltage value in tenths of volts<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtDefines the nominal voltage value in tenths of volts. Together with parameter No. 49 this is used by the automatic notification system to send reports on variations of voltage.</p&gt <p&gtDefault value: <b&gt2300</b&gt</p&gt <p&gtFrom: 1100 to 2500</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_49_1
parameter.label: 49: Fall In Maximum Voltage
parameter.description: Defines, the nominal value for max voltage fall permitted<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtDefines, as a percentage, the nominal value for permitted fall in maximum voltage.</p&gt <p&gtFrom: 1 (1%) to 100 (100%) Default value: <b&gt10 – 10%</b&gt</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_50_2
parameter.label: 50: Electric parameters
parameter.description: Defines which parameters will be subjected to notification<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtDefines which electric parameters, other than power, will be subjected to automatic notification.</p&gt <p&gtThe value to be set for this parameter must be calculated as the sum of values associated to the individual electric parameter indicated in the table of Manual.</p&gt <p&gtTo send report only for Power please set the value to 0.</p&gt <p&gtTo send report only for Power and Energy please set the value to 2 (0+2).</p&gt <p&gtTo send report for Power, Energy, Voltage, Current, Power Factor please set the value to 30 (0+2+4+8+16).</p&gt <p&gtBy default the report are sent for (Power, Energy, Voltage, Current, Power Factor) 0+2+4+8+16à30</p&gt <p&gtDefault value: <b&gt30</b&gt</p&gt <p&gtPermitted values: From 0 to 62</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_51_2
parameter.label: 51: Voltage RMS value
parameter.description: Reading of this parameter returns the value of voltage RMS<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtReading of this parameter returns the value of voltage RMS at the time of the reading expressed in tenths of Volts.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_52_2
parameter.label: 52: Current RMS value
parameter.description: Returns the value of current RMS expressed in hundredths of Amperes.

parameter.name: config_53_1
parameter.label: 53: Power Factor
parameter.description: Returns the value of power factor as a percentage

parameter.name: config_54_4
parameter.label: 54: Total energy consumed
parameter.description: Returns the value of total energy consumed expressed in Wh (thousandths of KWh).

parameter.name: config_55_4
parameter.label: 55: Total energy produced
parameter.description: Returns the value of total energy consumed expressed in Wh (thousandths of KWh).

parameter.name: config_60_1
parameter.label: 60: Start-up status
parameter.description: Defines the status of the device following a restart.

options.option: PREVIOUS STATUS: Status prior to restart

parameter.name: config_61_1
parameter.label: 61: Configuration reset
parameter.description: Defines which parameters should be reset to default values.

parameter.name: config_62_1
parameter.label: 62: Type of external switch
parameter.description: Defines the type of external switch connected to the device.

parameter.name: config_63_1
parameter.label: 63: Load Control
parameter.description: Defines the load control mode

parameter.name: group_1
parameter.label: 1: Lifeline
parameter.description: <br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtDevices who will receive notification on: status changes; energy level and power; local reset of the device</p&gt <p&gtReceived commands: Basic Report, Device Reset Locally Notification, Meter Report, Multilevel Sensor: Power Report</p&gt

parameter.name: group_2
parameter.label: 2: Up Power Level Group
parameter.description: <br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtDevices controlled from Up Power Event</p&gt

parameter.name: group_3
parameter.label: 3: Down Power Level Group
parameter.description: <br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtDevices controlled from Down Power Event</p&gt
